metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9381 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in QEMU in Xen allows local x86 HVM guest OS administrators to gain privileges by changing certain data on shared rings, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
No subscription required

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33').
xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.9').
